question_sentence: New York Yankees legend Derek Jeter was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame. How many World Series titles did he win?
Which of these things did the Perseverance rover collect on Mars for the first time?
In an interview with CBC, McDonald’s “Outstanding Manager of the Year” claimed Grimace was which of these things?
Defending Super Bowl champions Tampa Bay Buccaneers host this week’s NFL season opener. How old is their starting quarterback, Tom Brady?
Britney Spears’ father, Jamie, has filed to end the pop star’s conservatory that he controlled for how many years?
A year after Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam announced plans to remove it, what did the state take down this week?
choices: A statue of Robert E. Lee in Richmond
A statue of George Washington in Roanoke
A statue of George Rogers Clark in Charlottesville
A statue of Thomas Jefferson in Williamsburg

question_sentence: The original host of Blue’s Clues, Steve Burns, won over the internet this week with a heartfelt message saying:
choices: “We gotta find a pawprint, that’s the first clue.”
“After all these years, I never forgot you.”

question_sentence: True or false: A new Texas law banning abortions at six weeks includes an exception for victims of rape.
Michael K. Williams, who died Monday at age 54, famously played which character on “The Wire”?
Fill in the blank: Daily coronavirus infections are _______ what the U.S. saw on Labor Day last year.
The newly released made-for-TV film from US channel Lifetime about the Duke and Duchess of Sussex is called what?
evidence: The film is US channel Lifetime’s third fictional retelling of the couple’s life as royals

question_sentence: Boris Johnson’s planned 1.25% National Insurance tax rise is due to kick in when?
evidence: The tax increase announcement triggered fury among Conservative MPs, and accusations that Johnson is turning the Tories into ‘Blue Labour’

question_sentence: Which senior BBC journalist is stepping down from her role as the broadcaster’s director of news?
evidence: The hiring process to replace her in the influential role ‘will be keenly watched by those concerned about the politicisation of the BBC’, said the Press Gazette

question_sentence: Which city has been declared the ‘sinkhole capital of Europe’ as a growing number of chasms appear in its streets?
evidence: Called voragine in Italian, sinkholes had occurred at a rate of about 30 a year in central Rome for most of the past century, but the annual total has more than tripled in recent years

question_sentence: What is the codename for the government’s plan for the days following the Queen’s death?
evidence: Leaked documents seen by Politico this week revealed ‘the full extent of the preparations undertaken by the Royal Family’

question_sentence: A manhunt was launched this week for six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from one of Israel’s most secure jails how?
choices: By walking out of the front gate dressed as guards
By digging a tunnel under their toilet
By hiding in a laundry collection van
By pole vaulting over a 12ft-high security fence
evidence: The prison break was described by Israeli PM Naftali Bennett as a ‘grave incident’

question_sentence: Prince Charles’s closest aide quit after being accused of offering to help secure a knighthood for a Saudi tycoon who donated how much to royal charities?
evidence: Aide Michael Fawcett stepped down as chief executive of The Prince’s Foundation following an investigation by The Sunday Times

question_sentence: Emma Raducanu became the youngest British tennis player to reach the US Open final after beating who in straight sets in the semi-finals?
evidence: Just three months ago, Raducanu was a ‘waiting for her A-level results and wondering whether she might be granted a wild card into Wimbledon’, said The Telegraph

question_sentence: The world’s largest carbon-capture plant has opened in Iceland with the goal of removing up to how many tons of CO2 from the atmosphere each year?
evidence: Built by Swiss startup Climeworks AG, the plant sucks carbon dioxide directly from the air and injects it deep into the ground to be mineralised

question_sentence: Of a total £36bn expected to be raised in three years through the National Insurance hike, how much is the government pledging to pump into adult social care?
evidence: The manifesto-breaking 1.25% tax increase will kick in from next April, before being rebadged as a health and social care levy from 2023

question_sentence: As the rest of the country fell to Taliban rule, which of Afghanistan’s provinces was the last to be “conquered,” according to a Taliban spokesman?
evidence: Following nearly two weeks of fierce fighting between Taliban and resistance forces, the Taliban claimed victory in Afghanistan’s Panjshir province, the last remaining holdout of the country’s 34 provinces.

question_sentence: What tournament-specific record did Chilean pro golfer Joaquin Niemann set at the Tour Championship in Atlanta?
choices: quickest birdies achieved in a single round
most accurate drives in a tournament
evidence: Niemann, accompanied by his caddie and group of scorers, completed the fastest round of golf ever at a Tour Championship tournament by running the majority of the round, finishing in one hour, 53 minutes.

question_sentence: Which country’s “living with Covid” model is being challenged as it endures a fresh outbreak of the coronavirus?
evidence: Despite having one of the highest vaccination rates in the world, Singapore’s “living with Covid” strategy – attempting to control outbreaks with vaccines and monitoring hospitalizations rather than restricting citizens’ lives – is being challenged by a new outbreak of the Delta variant.

question_sentence: Pretrial hearings resumed in the case of Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, the accused mastermind of the September 11 terrorist attacks. Where did the hearings take place?
evidence: Mohammed, along with four other detainees – all of which are accused of plotting and executing the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks – appeared during pretrial hearings at a US Naval Station in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

question_sentence: Which school district became the first in the United States to mandate Covid-19 vaccinations for students 12 and older?
evidence: The Los Angeles Unified School Board unanimously voted to mandate Covid-19 vaccines for eligible students age 12 and older by the end of the year, the first such mandate for a school district in the country.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden approved a major disaster declaration with Sen. Chuck Schumer saying it was “the fastest (he’s) seen a major disaster area declared.” What were the disaster declarations in response to?
choices: unbearable drought in the Pacific Northwest
damage caused by the remnants of Hurricane Ida
an oil spill spanning multiple Gulf States
evidence: Biden approved the disaster declarations in response to vast damage caused by the remnants of Hurricane Ida, a storm that slammed states from Louisiana through the northeast of the United States.

question_sentence: Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott officially signed Senate Bill 1 into law. What’s the focus of the bill?
evidence: Senate Bill 1, often referred to as the “election integrity bill,” was signed into law, restricting access to voting by imposing new hurdles on mail-in ballots and even empowering partisan poll watchers.

question_sentence: According to a newly published study, what type of animal mimicked humans with the phrase “you bloody fool”?
evidence: According to the study featured in The Royal Society Publishing, an Australian musk duck was recorded imitating the phrase during a courtship display, the first documented case of the species mimicking human speech.

question_sentence: Which artist landed his 10th No. 1 album on Billboard’s Top 200 albums chart, becoming the seventh person ever to do so?
evidence: Kanye West took the top spot for his latest album “Donda,” an album that has racked up more than 775 million global streams since its release on August 29.

question_sentence: Based a news release from New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, what was he “thrilled to welcome back in its full form?”
choices: access to the Statue of Liberty
evidence: Mayor de Blasio was referring to the annual Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, a cherished event that was restricted to a TV-only crowd in 2020 due to restrictions surrounding the coronavirus pandemic.
